result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel D. Johnson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with Erin B, William S, their residence or place of employment.

timeConds.notes:
As a condition of probation as an ATR order signed 9/2/15.
To serve 100 days, or completion of the Living Free Program w/ credit since the 8/19/15 order to detain.

MINUTES:  9:18am-  Matter heard with 15CF465.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued.
